title: Fighting for Information: Court Access and the Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press
description: The governmental shift toward secrecy has not bypassed our state and federal courts systems. In the last few years, reporters have encountered increasing numbers of anonymous juries; dealt with creative judges finding interesting ways to justify sealing court proceedings and files and uncovered disturbing trends of secret dockets — entire court cases being filed and tried outside the public’s view.
